description:
A Fresh Way to Do Statistics

JASP is a cross-platform software that allows you to conduct statistical analyses in seconds, and without having to learn programming or risking a programming mistake. It aims to be a complete statistical package for both Bayesian and Frequentist statistical methods, that is easy to use and familiar to users of SPSS.
Release Note 0.95.1
Fixes
- Security Sandbox Failure (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-issues/issues/3626)
- Upgrading old JASP file sometimes fails (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-issues/issues/3656)
- Crash when opening help for Classical Meta-Analysis (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-issues/issues/3665)
- Variable icon types are sometimes not displayed in the Filter view (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop/pull/6011)
- Interactions in Linear Regression is not saved (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop/pull/6009)
- Too many factors in "Create Factorial Worksheet" analysis of Quality Control (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop/pull/6005)
- Crashes when refreshing or resizing some analyses (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop/pull/6015 and https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop/pull/6014)
- Generalized Logistic Regression does not work with Bernoulli family (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-issues/issues/3681)
New features
- Auto-save and Recovery: JASP saves automatically the current workspace in a temporary file. In case that JASP is closed abruptly, when restarting JASP, the user will have the possibility to open the temporary file in the Recovery menu (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop/pull/5999)
- Color R functions differently (https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-issues/issues/3443, https://github.com/jasp-stats/jasp-desktop/pull/5993)
- Turkish language support
